definition: (TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: Enriching consumptive disease, benefiting pneuma, protect lung and tonifying kidney, support healthy energy.
sentences.chinese: 補虛損，益精氣，保肺益腎，扶正固本。

definition: disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
shaking in fear/one's heart palpitating with fear
(TCM) plum-pit qi, a feeling of a lump in the throat (globus pharyngis) or of stagnant phlegm
